summary: Martin Chalfie is a biochemist from the United States.
full_text: Osamu Shimomura  is a Japanese organic chemist and marine biologist, and Professor Emeritus at Marine Biological Laboratory  in Woods Hole, Massachusetts and Boston University School of Medicine. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2008 for the discovery and development of green fluorescent protein  with two American scientists: Martin Chalfie of Columbia University and Roger Tsien of the University of California-San Diego.
title: Osamu Shimomura
